tweets.text: Hi @PHE_WestMids @EnvAgencyMids can we be real here? Residents exposure times are hours, not minutes, and repeatedly for at least 2 years. Can you accurately still say there‚Äôs no harm to human health? P.S how do you sleep at night? Because we can‚Äôt.üò¥ #stopthestink @StinkStopthe https://t.co/Y2RMaMkmJW

@LTroyWritings @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA Yep it definitely is in werrington as I just spoke to someone else who lives there . Have you complained to the EA and the SOT representative ?

@LTroyWritings @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA It‚Äôs appalling and the radius is getting wider , we had no issues until the start of this year. It‚Äôs now regular and the air gets absolutely thick with the times , if the @EnvAgency don‚Äôt stop this it‚Äôs going to suck Stoke in as well @StinkStopthe
Has the environment agency not responded to this many complaints? https://t.co/jSa6fKl8xw

Worked yesterday and today & have a full on diary for tomorrow yet know already it‚Äôs going to be impossible because the fumes are starting to seep into my home again. Tell me how I‚Äôm supposed to be effective at work tomorrow with no sleep tonight again @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency

The smell outside my house is that of a MAJOR gas leak but it is the STENCH from #Walleysquarrey which is already above a 6 This is a public health scandal @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @StinkStopthe #lestwedie

@dpcarrington @guardian #walleysquarry #landfill has had 11.5k complaints to @EnvAgency in 2021 alone. Easily the most important environmental issue in the UK now. The toxic gases are getting into hospitals, schools, homes and causing health problems. Please help! #stopthestink

urls.title: 'No consistent approach': EA review of groundwater flooding gives cause for concern
urls.description: There is "no consistent approach to planning, preparing, responding or recovering from groundwater flooding‚Äù, an Environment Agency (EA) review has concluded.

tweets.text: 'No consistent approach' &  gaps in knowledge, processes and data for managing #groundwater flood risk: EA review of groundwater flooding gives cause for concern https://t.co/jLtFl8B4s4 via @theENDSReport
